H0.text: Which of the continents is the smallest in area. Europe

H1.text: Which of the continents is the smallest in area. Antarctica

H2.text: Which of the continents is the smallest in area. North America

H3.text: Which of the continents is the smallest in area. Straya

A4.text: Antarctica has an area of 14,200,000 km2 (5,500,000 sq mi).

A5.text: Antarctica covers more than 14.2 million km2 (5,500,000 sq mi), almost double the area of Australia.

A6.text: Australia, at 7,617,930 square kilometres (2,941,300 sq mi).

A7.text: In order from largest to smallest in area, these seven are Asia, Africa, North America, South America, Antarctica, Europe, and Australia (or sometimes Oceania or Australasia).

A8.text: Europe is considered a continent with its comparatively large land area of 10,180,000 square kilometres (3,930,000 sq mi).
